com.amplifyframework.datastore

Class AWSDataStorePlugin

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.amplifyframework.datastore.DataStorePlugin<java.lang.Void>
      • com.amplifyframework.datastore.AWSDataStorePlugin
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CategoryTypeable, Plugin<java.lang.Void>, DataStoreCategoryBehavior

    public final class AWSDataStorePlugin
extends DataStorePlugin<java.lang.Void>
    An AWS implementation of the DataStorePlugin.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AWSDataStorePlugin

        public AWSDataStorePlugin()
                   throws DataStoreException
        Constructs an AWSDataStorePlugin which can warehouse the model types provided by your application's code-generated model provider. This model provider is expected to have the fully qualified class name of com.amplifyframework.datastore.generated.model.AmplifyModelProvider. This constructor will attempt to find that provide by means of reflection. If you have changed the path to your ModelProvider instance, and do not use the default path generated by the Amplify Code Generator, then this will break. Likewise, if you need to provide a custom ModelProvider, this will not work. In both cases, you should prefer one of the other overloads such as AWSDataStorePlugin(ModelProvider). If remote synchronization is enabled, it will be performed via Amplify.API.
        Throws:
        DataStoreException - If it is not possible to access the code-generated model provider

      • AWSDataStorePlugin

        public AWSDataStorePlugin(DataStoreConfiguration userProvidedConfiguration)
                   throws DataStoreException
        Constructs an AWSDataStorePlugin using a user-provided configuration. The plugin will be able to warehouse models as described in AWSDataStorePlugin().
        Parameters:
        userProvidedConfiguration - Additionally, consider these user-provided configuration options. These values override anything found in `amplifyconfiguration.json`. This configuration may also include hooks for conflict resolution and or global error handling.
        Throws:
        DataStoreException - If not possible to locate the code-generated model provider, com.amplifyframework.datastore.generated.model.AmplifyModelProvider.

      • AWSDataStorePlugin

        public AWSDataStorePlugin(ModelProvider modelProvider)
        Constructs an AWSDataStorePlugin which can warehouse the model types provided by the supplied ModelProvider. If the API plugin is present and configured, then remote synchronization will be performed through Amplify.API.
        Parameters:
        modelProvider - Provider of models to be usable by plugin

        public void configure(org.json.JSONObject pluginConfiguration,
                      android.content.Context context)
               throws DataStoreException
        Configure the plugin with customized configuration object. A plugin may or may not require plugin configuration, so see the documentation for details. This hook provides a good opportunity to instantiate resources. Any long-lived initialization should take place in Plugin.initialize(Context), instead.
        Parameters:
        pluginConfiguration - plugin-specific configuration data
        context - An Android Context
        Throws:
        DataStoreException

      • start

        public void start(Action onComplete,
                  Consumer<DataStoreException> onError)
        Starts the DataStore's synchronization with a remote system, if DataStore is configured to support remote synchronization. This only needs to be called if you wish to start the synchronization eagerly. If you don't call start(), the synchronization will start automatically, prior to executing any other operations (#query, #save, #delete, #observe).
        Parameters:
        onComplete - Invoked after DataStore is initialized. This does not block until subscriptions and sync are complete. To block until sync and subscriptions are complete, use Amplify.Hub.subscribe to listen for the DataStoreChannelEventName.READY event on HubChannel.DATASTORE.
        onError - Invoked if an exception occurs.

      • stop

        public void stop(Action onComplete,
                 Consumer<DataStoreException> onError)
        Stops the underlying DataStore, resetting the plugin to the initialized state.
        Parameters:
        onComplete - Invoked if the call is successful.
        onError - Invoked if an exception occurs.

      • clear

        public void clear(Action onComplete,
                  Consumer<DataStoreException> onError)
        Stops all synchronization processes and invokes the clear method of the underlying storage adapter. Any items pending synchronization in the outbound queue will be lost. Synchronization processes will be restarted on the next interaction with the DataStore.
        Parameters:
        onComplete - Invoked if the call is successful.
        onError - Invoked if not successful

      • getEscapeHatch

        public java.lang.Void getEscapeHatch()
        Returns escape hatch for plugin to enable lower-level client use-cases.
        Returns:
        the client used by category plugin; null, if there is no escape hatch

                                   Consumer<DataStoreItemChange<T>> onItemSaved,
                                   Consumer<DataStoreException> onFailureToSave)
        Saves an item into the DataStore.

        Parameters:

        onItemSaved - Called upon successful save of item
        onFailureToSave - Called upon failure to save item

      • save

        public <T extends Model> void save(T item,
                                   QueryPredicate predicate,
                                   Consumer<DataStoreItemChange<T>> onItemSaved,
                                   Consumer<DataStoreException> onFailureToSave)
        Saves an item into the DataStore if the data being overwritten meets the provided conditions. This is useful for making sure that no data is overwritten with an outdated/incorrect assumption.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The time of item being saved
        Parameters:
        item - An item to save
        predicate - Predicate condition to apply for conditional write
        onItemSaved - Called upon successful save of item
        onFailureToSave - Called upon failure to save item

      • query

        public <T extends Model> void query(java.lang.Class<T> itemClass,
                                    Consumer<java.util.Iterator<T>> onQueryResults,
                                    Consumer<DataStoreException> onQueryFailure)
        Query the DataStore to find all items of the requested Java class.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of items being queried
        Parameters:
        itemClass - Items of this class will be targeted by this query
        onQueryResults - Called when a query successfully returns 0 or more results
        onQueryFailure - Called when a failure interrupts successful completion of a query

      • query

        public void query(java.lang.String modelName,
                  QueryOptions options,
                  Consumer<java.util.Iterator<? extends Model>> onQueryResults,
                  Consumer<DataStoreException> onQueryFailure)
        Query the DataStore to find all items of the requested model (by name). NOTE: This private method is used only by hybrid platforms (Flutter, React Native), and should not be included into the DataStoreCategory spec.
        Parameters:
        modelName - name of the Model to query
        options - Filtering, paging, and sorting options
        onQueryResults - Called when a query successfully returns 0 or more results
        onQueryFailure - Called when a failure interrupts successful completion of a query

      • query

        public <T extends Model> void query(java.lang.Class<T> itemClass,
                                    QueryPredicate queryPredicate,
                                    Consumer<java.util.Iterator<T>> onQueryResults,
                                    Consumer<DataStoreException> onQueryFailure)
        Query the DataStore to find all items of the requested Java class that fulfills the predicate.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of items being queried
        Parameters:
        itemClass - Items of this class will be targeted by this query
        queryPredicate - Predicate condition to apply to query
        onQueryResults - Called when a query successfully returns 0 or more results
        onQueryFailure - Called when a failure interrupts successful completion of a query

      • query

        public <T extends Model> void query(java.lang.Class<T> itemClass,
                                    QueryOptions options,
                                    Consumer<java.util.Iterator<T>> onQueryResults,
                                    Consumer<DataStoreException> onQueryFailure)
        Description copied from interface: DataStoreCategoryBehavior
        Query the DataStore to find items of the requested Java class, using the provided QueryOptions. The query options include support for filtering, paging, and sorting.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of items being queried
        Parameters:
        itemClass - Class of items that will be queried
        options - Filtering, paging, and sorting options
        onQueryResults - Called when there are results available
        onQueryFailure - Called when there is a failure that prevents results from being rendered

      • observe

        public void observe(Consumer<Cancelable> onObservationStarted,
                    Consumer<DataStoreItemChange<? extends Model>> onDataStoreItemChange,
                    Consumer<DataStoreException> onObservationFailure,
                    Action onObservationCompleted)
        Description copied from interface: DataStoreCategoryBehavior
        Observe all changes to any/all item(s) in the DataStore.
        Parameters:
        onObservationStarted - Called when observation begins
        onDataStoreItemChange - Called 0..n times, once for each and every change that occurs to any/all item(s) in the DataStore.
        onObservationFailure - Called if observation of the DataStore terminates with a non-recoverable failure
        onObservationCompleted - Called when observation completes gracefully

      • observe

        public <T extends Model> void observe(java.lang.Class<T> itemClass,
                                      Consumer<Cancelable> onObservationStarted,
                                      Consumer<DataStoreItemChange<T>> onDataStoreItemChange,
                                      Consumer<DataStoreException> onObservationFailure,
                                      Action onObservationCompleted)
        Description copied from interface: DataStoreCategoryBehavior
        Observe changes to a certain type of item(s) in the DataStore.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the item(s) to observe
        Parameters:
        itemClass - The class of the item(s) to observe
        onObservationStarted - Called when observation begins
        onDataStoreItemChange - Called 0..n times, whenever there is a change to an item of the requested class
        onObservationFailure - Called if observation of the DataStore terminates with a non-recoverable failure
        onObservationCompleted - Called when observation completes gracefully

      • observe

        public void observe(java.lang.String modelName,
                    Consumer<Cancelable> onObservationStarted,
                    Consumer<DataStoreItemChange<? extends Model>> onDataStoreItemChange,
                    Consumer<DataStoreException> onObservationFailure,
                    Action onObservationCompleted)
        Observe changes to a certain type of item(s) in the DataStore.
        Parameters:
        modelName - The name of the model to observe
        onObservationStarted - Called when observation begins
        onDataStoreItemChange - Called 0..n times, whenever there is a change to an item of the requested class
        onObservationFailure - Called if observation of the DataStore terminates with a non-recoverable failure
        onObservationCompleted - Called when observation completes gracefully

      • observe

        public <T extends Model> void observe(java.lang.Class<T> itemClass,
                                      java.lang.String uniqueId,
                                      Consumer<Cancelable> onObservationStarted,
                                      Consumer<DataStoreItemChange<T>> onDataStoreItemChange,
                                      Consumer<DataStoreException> onObservationFailure,
                                      Action onObservationCompleted)
        Description copied from interface: DataStoreCategoryBehavior
        Observe changes to a specific item, identified by its class and unique ID.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of item being observed
        Parameters:
        itemClass - The class of the item being observed
        uniqueId - The unique ID of the item being observed
        onObservationStarted - Called when observation begins
        onDataStoreItemChange - Called 0..n times, whenever there are changes to the item which is uniquely identified by the provided class and unique ID. Note that this callback will be invoked many times for a single item, in the case where the item is updated many times.
        onObservationFailure - Called if observation of the DataStore terminates with a non-recoverable failure
        onObservationCompleted - Called when observation completes gracefully

      • observe

        public <T extends Model> void observe(java.lang.Class<T> itemClass,
                                      QueryPredicate selectionCriteria,
                                      Consumer<Cancelable> onObservationStarted,
                                      Consumer<DataStoreItemChange<T>> onDataStoreItemChange,
                                      Consumer<DataStoreException> onObservationFailure,
                                      Action onObservationCompleted)
        Description copied from interface: DataStoreCategoryBehavior
        Observe a collection of item(s) that have a specified class type, and that match additional criteria, specified by a fluent chain of selection operators.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the item(s) to observe
        Parameters:
        itemClass - The class of item(s) to observe
        selectionCriteria - Additional criteria which will be considered when identifying which items in the DataStore should be observed for changes.
        onObservationStarted - Called when observation begins
        onDataStoreItemChange - Called 0..n times, whenever there are changes to models of the given class, that additionally match the provided selection criteria
        onObservationFailure - Called if observation of the DataStore terminates with a non-recoverable failure
        onObservationCompleted - Called when observation completes gracefully
